name: New Year's Day
description: Public holiday — First day of the Gregorian calendar year

name: Makar Sankranti
description: Observance — Harvest festival marking the transition of the sun into Capricorn

name: Republic Day
description: Public holiday — Commemorates the adoption of the Constitution of India on January 26, 1950

name: Maha Shivaratri
description: Observance — Hindu festival dedicated to Lord Shiva

name: Holi
description: Public holiday — Hindu festival of colors celebrating the arrival of spring

name: Ugadi
description: Regional holiday — New Year's Day for the states of Andhra Pradesh, Karnataka, and Telangana

name: Good Friday
description: Public holiday — Christian observance commemorating the crucifixion of Jesus Christ

name: Ram Navami
description: Observance — Hindu festival celebrating the birth of Lord Rama

name: Mahavir Jayanti
description: Observance — Jain festival celebrating the birth of Mahavira

name: Ambedkar Jayanti
description: Public holiday — Commemorates the birthday of Dr. B.R. Ambedkar

name: Eid ul-Fitr
description: Public holiday — Islamic festival marking the end of Ramadan

name: Buddha Purnima
description: Public holiday — Celebrates the birth, enlightenment, and death of Gautama Buddha

name: Eid ul-Adha
description: Public holiday — Islamic festival of sacrifice commemorating Ibrahim's willingness to sacrifice his son

name: Muharram
description: Observance — Islamic New Year and day of mourning

name: Independence Day
description: Public holiday — Commemorates India's independence from British rule on August 15, 1947

name: Raksha Bandhan
description: Observance — Hindu festival celebrating the bond between brothers and sisters

name: Janmashtami
description: Public holiday — Celebrates the birth of Lord Krishna

name: Ganesh Chaturthi
description: Public holiday — Hindu festival honoring Lord Ganesha

name: Onam
description: Regional holiday — Harvest festival celebrated in Kerala

name: Gandhi Jayanti
description: Public holiday — Commemorates the birthday of Mahatma Gandhi, Father of the Nation

name: Dussehra
description: Public holiday — Hindu festival celebrating the victory of good over evil

name: Diwali
description: Public holiday — Festival of lights celebrating the victory of light over darkness

name: Govardhan Puja
description: Observance — Hindu festival celebrated the day after Diwali

name: Bhai Dooj
description: Observance — Festival celebrating the bond between brothers and sisters

name: Guru Nanak Jayanti
description: Public holiday — Celebrates the birth of Guru Nanak, founder of Sikhism

name: Christmas
description: Public holiday — Christian festival celebrating the birth of Jesus Christ
